image.altText: Screengrab of mobile vision showing people with blurred faces standing under an awning.

props.synopsis: South Australia's Attorney-General and Aboriginal Affairs Minister Kyam Maher has spoken to the state's Police Commissioner, following "confronting" footage taken during an arrest near Port Augusta at the weekend.

title.children: 'Confronting' vision of a man being dragged by police has prompted a formal assessment — what happened and what is the response?

image.altText: Natasha Stott Despoja chairing the domestic violence royal commission.

props.synopsis: In the space of a single week, four women were killed in separate and unrelated incidents in SA. A year on, the state is set to begin its royal commission into domestic violence.

title.children: Domestic violence royal commission begins hearings a year after 'worst week in any jurisdiction'

image.altText: A woman on a beach with severely weathered ropes around her neck

props.synopsis: Kangaroo Island tour guides Mia Bertetto and Nikki Redman say they have a blunt message for tourists and locals — "don't garbage paradise".

title.children: The 'heartbreaking, never-ending' rubbish on Australia's third-largest island

image.altText: A blue sculpture on a footpath outside a historic building

props.synopsis: A sculpture design has caused a stir in a regional South Australian community, but the local council says that is the point of public art.

title.children: Mount Gambier's 'blue blob' sculpture to go ahead, despite fierce online backlash

image.altText: black and white image of koala on podium

props.synopsis: Commercial radio started with a bang in Adelaide after a live broadcast of federal election results in 1925 prompted a police response when 5,000 people gathered outside the studio of 5CL, which would later become the ABC.

title.children: From amateur broadcasts reaching New York, to the ABC and SA-FM's Skyshow, Adelaide celebrates 100 years of radio

image.altText: readbook2

props.synopsis: A government department says it will stop partnering with a charity run by Plymouth Brethren Christian Church members. A school run by church members has also been referred to regulators following allegations that students are discouraged from attending on-campus university.

title.children: SA Health to cut ties with charity run by Brethren members, school referred to regulators

image.altText: A dark-haired woman wearing a white top.

props.synopsis: A Victorian woman who killed her husband by feeding him temazepam-laced lemon biscuits before stuffing him in a freezer has had her murder sentence reduced to 12 years behind bars.

title.children: Woman who murdered her husband with drugged biscuits has jail sentence reduced

image.altText: A baby wearing a hair tie smiles while playing with toys in a living room

props.synopsis: An inquest will consider how a manipulative father was able to take his life and that of his baby daughter on the same day he was allowed access to her.

title.children: Man who killed baby daughter at Whispering Wall breached non-contact order 149 times

image.altText: A close up view of a smoke stack at the Whyalla steelworks, taken at sunset

props.synopsis: The company says it will use some of the funds to fix the Whyalla steelwork's blast furnace which has been offline since August.

title.children: GFG Alliance secures $150 million loan to pay staff and fund repairs

image.altText: Inside a factory where steel is being made.

props.synopsis: The boss of Australia's largest steelmaker is confident the business is well placed to succeed under a second Donald Trump presidency, despite the president-elect's promise of widespread tariffs.

title.children: Bluescope monitoring Trump tariffs 'closely' ahead of US Colorbond launch

image.altText: A sandy bay with a small jetty and swimming pontoon

props.synopsis: Port Elliot's swimming pontoon has been loved by local swimmers, surf clubs and tourists for over a decade, but the council says it could cost $186,000 annually to reinstall it after it washed up on the beach during a storm.

title.children: Council seeks 'low cost' options to get swimming pontoon back in the water after $180k insurance shock

image.altText: Elderly woman sits on her bed longingly holding an old black and white photo of her younger self next to her late husband.

props.synopsis: When Shirley met the love of her life at age 19, Australian society didn't allow her and her soulmate to be together.

title.children: The enduring love story that defied the White Australia policy

image.altText: Radio host David Bevan on air.

props.synopsis: Renowned, esteemed and much-loved ABC Radio Adelaide presenter David Bevan has announced his retirement after more than 20 years on the airwaves.

title.children: 'You've ruined my eye make-up': David Bevan's retirement prompts tributes and tears from listeners

image.altText: Central Station in Sydney

props.synopsis: Industrial action will freeze all train services across Greater Sydney from Friday to Sunday morning. Here is what the strike means for commuters.

title.children: Sydney's looming train shutdown set to cause 'massive disruption'

image.altText: an elderly woman looking at the camera

props.synopsis: A jury is considering its verdict in Senior Constable Kristian White's manslaughter trial. The police officer tasered great-grandmother Clare Nowland, who later died in hospital.

title.children: Jury retires to consider fate of NSW police officer who tasered a 95yo woman

image.altText: Palestinians with backpack cary household items as they flee along an unsealed road that runs between damaged buildings.

props.synopsis: The IDF's siege of northern Gaza is now into its second month, leading many to question whether Israel has adopted a controversial plan to conquer the area.

title.children: Former general who plans to starve 'combatants' out of northern Gaza slams critics

image.altText: Photo of a young woman with red hair and nose piercings

props.synopsis: Detectives from the Missing Persons Squad have charged a 53-year-old man with murder and a 57-year-old man with assisted murder after the disappearance of 19-year-old Brunswick woman Isla Bell.

title.children: Man charged with murder after human remains found at a tip during search for missing Melbourne teenager Isla Bell

image.altText: Socceroos players walk slowly with their heads down

props.synopsis: The Socceroos managed 21 shots on target in their last two internationals, but scored just twice. Tony Popovic's side can ill afford such profligacy in front of goal in a desperately tight World Cup qualification group.

title.children: The Socceroos were once again wasteful against Bahrain — and it could cost them dearly

image.altText: Trump attends SpaceX's launch of world's most powerful rocket

props.synopsis: SpaceX has aborted an attempt to catch the first stage booster of its Starship mega rocket in the "chopstick" arms of its launch tower in an ocean splashdown.

title.children: SpaceX fails to catch megarocket in 'chopstick' arms as Trump, Musk look on

image.altText: A woman with short auburn hair looks at the ground while walking through a door

props.synopsis: The Frenchwoman and her ex-husband have given their final statements in court as the mass rape trial involving 51 men enters its final stages.

title.children: Gisele Pelicot says mass rape trial of 51 men is one of 'cowardice'

image.altText: A bird's eye view of unit blocks and apartments with the ocean in the background on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: The typical household faces spending half their income to service a new home loan, according to research from ANZ and CoreLogic. The local share market edges lower following a mixed finish on Wall Street. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: Housing affordability deteriorates further, ASX drops

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Wages and salaries paid to employees passes $100 billion
Nick Scali shares hit four-month low over delivery delays
ASX keeps sliding away from record high at lunch

image.altText: Two white men wear khaki flak jackets and helmets as they address the camera while standing in front of a beach

props.synopsis: In a visit to Gaza, Benjamin Netanyahu promised $5 million to anyone who helped Israeli hostages in the besieged territory to escape Hamas.

title.children: Israeli PM visits Gaza, offers $5 million reward for Palestinians who help hostages

image.altText: A man's side profile.

props.synopsis: The government says a controversial ministerial directive will remain in place if it cannot pass its bill to cap international student enrolments from next year — a likely scenario due to the Coalition announcing it will vote against it.

title.children: Regional universities warn of 'disastrous' consequences if scheme to manage student visas remains in place

image.altText: A woman with red hair sits in an office with brightly coloured wallpaper behind her

props.synopsis: The prolific wallpaper designer reinvented herself many times and embroidered her biography. But years after her death, her murderer is still unknown.

title.children: Glamorous designer Florence Broadhurst's secrets came out at her funeral, but her killer remains unknown

image.altText: Vladimir Putin wearing a dark suit, tie and blue shirt sitting emotionless at a wooden desk in front of a Russian flag

props.synopsis: The new doctrine says the Kremlin would consider a nuclear strike in response to the use of conventional weapons against Russia or Belarus.

title.children: Vladimir Putin lowers Russia's threshold for using nuclear weapons

image.altText: Smokey rubble with house in background

props.synopsis: G20 summit calls for peace in the Ukraine-Russia and Middle East war, just before Russia claimed Ukraine had begun launching American-made long-range missiles into its territory.

title.children: World leaders call for peace in Ukraine-Russia war and Middle East

image.altText: A man in a suit speaks at the camera.

props.synopsis: The announcement was made at the United Nations climate summit in Azerbaijan. Climate economists say rich countries will need to commit much more money to make a difference.

title.children: Australia commits additional $50 million to deal with climate change

image.altText: Business people walk past a shiny black sign that reads "Reserve Bank of Australia".

props.synopsis: Minutes from the RBA board's last meeting suggest a rate cut is not assured even if December inflation is low using the Reserve Bank's favoured "underlying" measure, which excludes volatile items.

title.children: RBA says February rate cut not guaranteed even if inflation figures rosy

image.altText: A woman in a wheelchair smiles as she plays an aqua bass guitar

props.synopsis: These venues are proving a commitment to accessibility can start with simple, cheap and practical changes, that can make an important difference.

title.children: 'You want to be a headliner': Venues are trying to make gigs more accessible

image.altText: A "sorry we're closed" sign in the window of a shopfront.

props.synopsis: The rate of business failures is now the highest it has been since the COVID-19 pandemic, and it is only set to grow as the cost of doing business squeezes companies from all sides.

title.children: Businesses are failing at near the highest rate on record

image.altText: Donald Trump hush money case

props.synopsis: Prosecutors who secured Donald Trump's conviction over a hush money payment say they will accept a delay in the case as the incoming president seeks to have it dismissed.

title.children: New York prosecutors accept delay on Trump hush money sentencing

image.altText: A woman stands for a mugshot holding a corrections board

props.synopsis: Susan Smith is facing a parole board for the first time more than three decades after she confessed to killing her two sons and lying about their abduction.

title.children: Susan Smith's ex fights to keep her in jail 30 years after she claimed their sons were abducted and murdered

image.altText: A headshot of Sean Combs wearing sunglasses and a black and white striped jacket

props.synopsis: A US judge has ordered prosecutors to destroy their copies of handwritten notes seized from Sean "Diddy" Combs' jail cell, pending a decision on whether they can be used as evidence.

title.children: Prosecutors barred from consulting potentially incriminating notes seized from Sean 'Diddy' Combs' jail cell

image.altText: Harry Armstrong and Harvey Langford pose together for a photo

props.synopsis: The AFL draft offers struggling clubs a ticket back to the top, but not every team approaches it in the same way. The stakes are high for Richmond, West Coast and others and their radically different draft strategies are about to be put to the test.

title.children: The futures of Richmond, West Coast and others may well be shaped by what happens tonight and tomorrow
